overview: Rural Land Register - when you need to register land, how to register, what to send with your application, how to contact Rural Payments Agency
title: Register land with the Rural Land Register

table.body:
You must register land with the Rural Land Register (RLR) to claim from most land-based funding schemes, including:

- Environmental Stewardship schemes
- the English Woodland Grant Scheme

##Single Payment Scheme

You don't have to register with the RLR to apply for the Single Payment Scheme, but it may speed up your claim. 

If your land isn't registered, you'll need to send in a map of it with your Single Payment Scheme claim form.

^Even if you’ve previously [registered land with the Land Registry](/registering-land-or-property-with-land-registry "Register land or property with Land Registry"), you'll still need to register it with the RLR. ^

##What to register 

You only need to register land that you want to claim payments on. This includes land that:

- you farm
- qualifies for land-based payment schemes (eg because it has environmental value) 


##What you'll get 

You'll get a complete set of maps showing your registered land.

*[RLR]:Rural Land Registry
table.title: Overview

table.body:
##Customer registration

Before you [register your land](/register-land-with-the-rural-land-register/how-to-register-land-or-change-a-registration "register your land or change a registration"), you need to register as a customer with the Rural Payments Agency (RPA). You'll need to tell them:

- the name and address of your business
- who is legally responsible for your business
- the address of your land (including the grid reference or postcode)
- who your main contact person should be and what powers they should have

The main contact person can be yourself, a person legally responsible for your business or someone independent (an agent). You can give an agent full powers (empowerment) to deal with your land registration, or partial powers (eg they can access information but not change it). 

$D [Download a leaflet about the different levels of empowerment you can give your contact person (PDF, 240KB)](http://rpa.defra.gov.uk/rpa/index.nsf/b50e2d95da0b0bda80256f8100404bc7/2aabed9f6008f4af802578850054c7a9/$FILE/Empowerments%20Leaflet.pdf "Download 'Empowerments' (PDF, 240KB)"){:rel="external"} $D

Call the RPA to give this information for the first time or change existing contact details for your business.

$C**Rural Payments Agency**

0845 603 7777
$C

You'll receive a Single Business Identifier for your business, and each person will get a Personal Identifier. You'll need these to register your land.

##Landlords and tenants

Either the landlord or the tenant can register land on the Rural Land Register, but the land can only be registered once.

However, it's possible for the landlord to claim funds under one land scheme and their tenant to claim under another.

*[RPA]:Rural Payments Agency
table.title: Who can register

table.body:
You can use the RLE1 form to:

- register new land for the first time
- make changes to land already on the Rural Land Register (eg if the boundaries change or if you sell the land to someone else)

Fill in the form and post it to the Rural Payments Agency (RPA). You can either download the form below or ask the RPA to send you a pre-printed copy.

^You'll need to give your Single Business Identifier - you'll get this when you complete the [customer registration process](/register-land-with-the-rural-land-register/who-can-register "Who can register") for the first time.^

You also need to enclose a map with a visible scale if you're registering land for the first time, or if your boundaries have changed. Mark your land boundaries clearly with a fine-tipped pen. 
 
##RLE1 form and guidance on filling it out

$D [Download the 'Rural Land and Entitlements RLE1' form (PDF, 96KB)](http://rpa.defra.gov.uk/rpa/index.nsf/0/3fa781235a3f041d8025710d0030cb56/$FILE/ATTK0GMK/RLE1%20Form.pdf "Download the 'Rural Land and Entitlements RLE1' form (PDF, 96KB)"){:rel="external"} $D

$D [Download 'RLE1 Guidance' (PDF, 2.4 MB)](http://rpa.defra.gov.uk/rpa/index.nsf/15f3e119d8abcb5480256ef20049b53a/3fa781235a3f041d8025710d0030cb56/$FILE/ATT21JGK/RLE%201%20Guidance%20Feb%202011%20v1.0.pdf "Download 'RLE1 Guidance' (PDF, 2.4 MB)"){:rel="external"} $D

$D [Download 'RLE1 Checklist' (PDF, 82KB)](http://rpa.defra.gov.uk/rpa/index.nsf/15f3e119d8abcb5480256ef20049b53a/3fa781235a3f041d8025710d0030cb56/$FILE/ATTJ7QX6/RLE%201%20checklist%20v%202.0%20may%202011.pdf "Download 'RLE1 Checklist' (PDF, 82KB)"){:rel="external"}  $D

table.title: How to register land or change a registration

table.body:
The Rural Land Register only covers land in England. 

If your land is in more than one country, you'll need to register each piece of land separately for each country.

Contact the Rural Payments Agency if you have land in more than one country and have questions about your land in England.  

$C **Rural Payments Agency**

<csc@rpa.gsi.gov.uk>  
0845 603 7777  
$C

Use the numbers below if you have land in more than one country and have questions about land in Scotland, Northern Ireland or Wales.

##Land in Scotland
 
$C **Scottish Executive Environment and Rural Affairs Development** 

08457 741 741 $C

##Land in Northern Ireland

$C **Department of Agriculture and Rural Development**

02871 319 900  $C

##Land in Wales

$C **Agriculture Department, Divisional Office of the National Assembly for Wales** 

02920 752 222  $C
